title: What are the different genres of music? - Quora

response.answer_text: Starting with the common ones... PopPop comes from the word "Popular". It is the trend that most of the common folks are following. The aim of the music is to appeal to a general audience, rather than to a particular sub-culture or ideology. Katy Perry was topping on Pop music charts a few months back, when suddenly Gangnam Style came to conquer our playlists. In Pop music, the artistic and technical aspects are given lesser attention than the "poppy" feel.  Famous Artists : Taylor Swift, Lady Gaga, Pink, Chris BrownSub-genres : Disco-Pop, Country-Pop, Space Age Hip-HopHiphop or Rap is the style that involver the rhyming and rhythmic speech style that we call as rapping. If you are of my age, you probably grew up in the golden age of this genre with the guys like Eminem and 50 Cent booming in your earphones all the time. This grew faster with the advent of technology including DJing and scratching, beatboxing and easy-to-use looping softwares. Famous Artists : JayZ, Eminem, Drake, Nicki MinajSub-genres : GFunk, Rap-Rock, Hip-House RockIt grew up with Guitars. Any Rock group would consist of Electric Guitars, Bass and Drums. Rock places a higher degree of emphasis on musicianship, live performance, and an ideology of authenticity than pop music. Rock emphasizes on heavy beats and unlike pop, may focus on things other than romance. Most of the famous rock songs are built on philosophical themes.  This genre slowly mixed with other genres to produce new types. Some of them will be discussed soon. Famous Artists : Led Zeppelin, 12 Stones, The Beach Boys, Beatles, Eric ClaptonSub-genres : Alternative, Punk Rock, Progressive, Hard Rock JazzJazz is said to be popularized by Afro-Americans. Jazz uses blue notes, syncopation, swing, call and response, polyrhythms, and improvisation. It includes a wide range of instruments ranging from Piano to Guitars to Wind Instruments. Famous Artists : Frank Sinatra, Nancy WilsonSub-genres : Jazz Blues, Bebop, Swing BluesThe blues is a vocal and instrumental form of music based on the use of the blue notes and a repetitive pattern which is most of the time a twelve-bar structure. It evolved in the United States in the communities of former African slaves, from spirituals, praise songs, field hollers, shouts, and chants. Famous Artists : Jimmy Rogers, David MaxwellSub-genres : Jazz Blues, Country Blues CountryCountry music often consists of ballads and dance tunes with generally simple forms and harmonies accompanied by mostly string instruments such as banjoes, electric, acoustic guitars, harmonicas. Play a country song in a calm evening and you'll feel yourself retired in a cool green countryside, or find yourself driving on the muddy roads. Famous Artists : Lady Antebellum, Brad Paisley, Bob DylanSub-genres : Blues Country, Bluegrass, Country-Rock MetalMetal is a genre of rock music that came up during 1970's. You recognize a music piece is metal when you either start banging your head with every beat or run away from it (yeah there're people who do so). It is characterized by highly amplified distortion, extended guitar solos, thick massive sound and overall loudness. The lyrics may range from plain philosophy to rage against warfare and human ruthlessness and anger. Famous Artists : Metallica, Iron Maiden, Slayer, MegadethSub-genres : Trash Metal, Black Metal, Death Metal, Gothic Metal ============================================== Just these popular ones took so much space that I won't be discussing them here. Just go out to a music store and explore. You'll love the vast vast world of melodies...

There’s a lot of genres from all over the world! But I’m assuming this is about music that English speakers listen to, so I’ll narrow it down according to what English speakers usually listen to. Alternative Art PunkAlternative RockCollege RockCrossover ThrashExperimental RockGothic RockGrungeHardcore PunkHard RockIndie RockNew WaveProgressive RockPunkand lots and lots more of the lesser known alternative genreBlues Acoustic BluesChicago BluesClassic BluesContemporary BluesCountry BluesClassical MedievalOrchestralChoralPiano?Contemporary Classicaland lot’s more I probably missedCountry AmericanaAlternative Country (Johnny Cash is quite exceptional)Traditional Country (Hank Williams is quite good)Traditional BluegrassBluegrassCountry PopHonky Tonk (my favourite hehe)I don’t really listen to country, so if any country fan wants to add on just let me know.EDM / Electronic Music BreakdanceChillstepDubstep (WUBWUBWUBWUB)HouseTropicalTechnoTranceTrapDrum N’ BassGlitchhopHardcore? (it’s just a bunch of noise if you ask me)Deep HouseAmbientIndustrial (ex: Nine Inch Nails)Trip Hop (one of my personal favourite ex: Massive Attack and Portishead)and lot’s more of the lesser known categories again.Hip Hop / Rap Contemporary Hip Hop (ex: Panda - Desiigner)Alternative Rap (Public Enemy)Old School Hip HopEast Coast RapWest Coast RapUnderground RapDirty South (Lil Wayne, Outkast)Holiday ChristmasThanksgivingHannakahEasterbasically holidays it’s self explanatoryChristian Gospel Christian RockChristian MetalChristian RapChristian everythingOh, and my personal favourite of this category: TRADITIONAL GOSPEL! Where they um chant you know and sing in unison, you get what I mean?Jazz (my favourite) Acid Jazz (actually pretty good despite the name)Avant-Garde Jazz (think John Coltrane)Big Band (sorta like George Gershwin I suppose)Contemporary JazzCool Jazz (My favourite of them all: Dave Brubeck)Crossover JazzLatin Jazz (Stan Getz anyone?)Smooth JazzTraditional JazzPop Adult Contemporaries (easy listening pop music)Britpop (AND AFTER ALL YOU’RE MY WONDERWALL!)Dance PopSoft RockTeen Pop? Jonas Brothers nuff saidSynthpopR&B / Soul Contemporary R&BDiscoFunkDoo Wop (The Platters friend)Modern SoulMotown (Marvin Gaye is a good example)Neo-SoulSouthern SoulSoulSoul BluesRock (oh boy this is going to be long) Alternative RockAcid RockArena RockArt RockBlues RockEverybody’s favourite: British Invasion of the 60sDeath MetalHeavy MetalDoom MetalGothic MetalProgressive MetalStoner Metal (duuude heeeeeel YEAAA!)Metal CoreHardcore MetalClassic MetalThrash MetalHair MetalLot’s of MetalGlam Rock (rip Bowie)Math Rock (think of the band Foals, sorta)Rock & RollPsychedelic RockSouthern RockNoise Rock (it’s really noisy mind you, like Japanese rock)Surf Rock (thanks Beach Boys)throwing rocks at peopleI’m done with this genre, moving onFolk Alternative FolkContemporary FolkIndie Folk (love you Andrew Bird)Folk-Rock (love you too Simon & Garfunkel)Love FolkNew AcousticsSoundtrack Foreign Soundtracks?Musical SoundtracksOriginal ScoresMovie Soundtracks (Ennio Morricone lives on!)This is only the English counterpart of musical genre, so as for the rest of the world I can’t even imagine. If you have any other add ons, please suggest them to me so I can add them on!
